15#ifndef DNS_DNS64_H
16#define DNS_DNS64_H 1
17
18#include <stdbool.h>
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21
22#include <dns/types.h>
23
24ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
25
26/*
27 * dns_dns64_create() flags.
28 */
29#define DNS_DNS64_RECURSIVE_ONLY 0x01 /* If set then this record
30 * only applies to recursive
31 * queries.
32 */
33#define DNS_DNS64_BREAK_DNSSEC 0x02 /* If set then still perform
34 * DNSSEC synthesis even
35 * though the result would
36 * fail validation.
37 */
38
39/*
40 * dns_dns64_aaaaok() and dns_dns64_aaaafroma() flags.
41 */
42#define DNS_DNS64_RECURSIVE 0x01 /* Recursive query. */
43#define DNS_DNS64_DNSSEC 0x02 /* DNSSEC sensitive query. */
44
45isc_result_t
46dns_dns64_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, const isc_netaddr_t *prefix,
47 unsigned int prefixlen, const isc_netaddr_t *suffix,
48 dns_acl_t *client, dns_acl_t *mapped, dns_acl_t *excluded,
49 unsigned int flags, dns_dns64_t **dns64);
50/*
51 * Create a dns64 record which is used to identify the set of clients
52 * it applies to and how to perform the DNS64 synthesis.
53 *
54 * 'prefix' and 'prefixlen' defined the leading bits of the AAAA records
55 * to be synthesised. 'suffix' defines the bits after the A records bits.
56 * If suffix is NULL zeros will be used for these bits. 'client' defines
57 * for which clients this record applies. If 'client' is NULL then all
58 * clients apply. 'mapped' defines which A records are candidated for
59 * mapping. If 'mapped' is NULL then all A records will be mapped.
60 * 'excluded' defines which AAAA are to be treated as non-existent for the
61 * purposed of determining whether to perform syntesis. If 'excluded' is
62 * NULL then no AAAA records prevent synthesis.
63 *
64 * If DNS_DNS64_RECURSIVE_ONLY is set then the record will only match if
65 * DNS_DNS64_RECURSIVE is set when calling dns_dns64_aaaaok() and
66 * dns_dns64_aaaafroma().
67 *
68 * If DNS_DNS64_BREAK_DNSSEC is set then the record will still apply if
69 * DNS_DNS64_DNSSEC is set when calling dns_dns64_aaaaok() and
70 * dns_dns64_aaaafroma() otherwise the record will be ignored.
71 *
72 * Requires:
73 * 'mctx' to be valid.
74 * 'prefix' to be valid and the address family to AF_INET6.
75 * 'prefixlen' to be one of 32, 40, 48, 56, 72 and 96.
76 * the bits not covered by prefixlen in prefix to
77 * be zero.
78 * 'suffix' to be NULL or the address family be set to AF_INET6
79 * and the leading 'prefixlen' + 32 bits of the 'suffix'
80 * to be zero. If 'prefixlen' is 40, 48 or 56 then the
81 * the leading 'prefixlen' + 40 bits of 'suffix' must be
82 * zero.
83 * 'client' to be NULL or a valid acl.
84 * 'mapped' to be NULL or a valid acl.
85 * 'excluded' to be NULL or a valid acl.
86 *
87 * Returns:
88 * ISC_R_SUCCESS
89 * ISC_R_NOMEMORY
90 */
91
92void
93dns_dns64_destroy(dns_dns64_t **dns64p);
94/*
95 * Destroys a dns64 record.
96 *
97 * Requires the record to not be linked.
98 */
99
100isc_result_t
101dns_dns64_aaaafroma(const dns_dns64_t *dns64, const isc_netaddr_t *reqaddr,
102 const dns_name_t *reqsigner, const dns_aclenv_t *env,
103 unsigned int flags, unsigned char *a, unsigned char *aaaa);
104/*
105 * dns_dns64_aaaafroma() determines whether to perform a DNS64 address
106 * synthesis from 'a' based on 'dns64', 'reqaddr', 'reqsigner', 'env',
107 * 'flags' and 'aaaa'. If synthesis is performed then the result is
108 * written to '*aaaa'.
109 *
110 * The synthesised address will be of the form:
111 *
112 * <prefix bits><a bits><suffix bits>
113 *
114 * If <a bits> straddle bits 64-71 of the AAAA record, then 8 zero bits will
115 * be inserted at bits 64-71.
116 *
117 * Requires:
118 * 'dns64' to be valid.
119 * 'reqaddr' to be valid.
120 * 'reqsigner' to be NULL or valid.
121 * 'env' to be valid.
122 * 'a' to point to a IPv4 address in network order.
123 * 'aaaa' to point to a IPv6 address buffer in network order.
124 *
125 * Returns:
126 * ISC_R_SUCCESS if synthesis was performed.
127 * DNS_R_DISALLOWED if there is no match.
128 */
129
130dns_dns64_t *
131dns_dns64_next(dns_dns64_t *dns64);
132/*
133 * Return the next dns64 record in the list.
134 */
135
136void
137dns_dns64_append(dns_dns64list_t *list, dns_dns64_t *dns64);
138/*
139 * Append the dns64 record to the list.
140 */
141
142void
143dns_dns64_unlink(dns_dns64list_t *list, dns_dns64_t *dns64);
144/*
145 * Unlink the dns64 record from the list.
146 */
147
148bool
149dns_dns64_aaaaok(const dns_dns64_t *dns64, const isc_netaddr_t *reqaddr,
150 const dns_name_t *reqsigner, const dns_aclenv_t *env,
151 unsigned int flags, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
152 bool *aaaaok, size_t aaaaoklen);
153/*
154 * Determine if there are any non-excluded AAAA records in from the
155 * matching dns64 records in the list starting at 'dns64'. If there
156 * is a non-exluded address return true. If all addresses are
157 * excluded in the matched records return false. If no records
158 * match then return true.
159 *
160 * If aaaaok is defined then dns_dns64_aaaaok() return a array of which
161 * addresses in 'rdataset' were deemed to not be exclude by any matching
162 * record. If there are no matching records then all entries are set
163 * to true.
164 *
165 * Requires
166 * 'rdataset' to be valid and to be for type AAAA and class IN.
167 * 'aaaaoklen' must match the number of records in 'rdataset'
168 * if 'aaaaok' in non NULL.
169 */
170
171ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
172
173#endif /* DNS_DNS64_H */
174
